intro: Sanicula trilobata, commonly known as three-lobed sanicle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbel-like clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Sanicula trilobata thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
